Module Contents

class django.utils.functional.cached_property(func, name=None)[source]

Decorator that converts a method with a single self argument into a property cached on the instance.

A cached property can be made out of an existing method: (e.g. url = cached_property(get_absolute_url)).

name = None[source]
static func(instance)[source]
real_func[source]
class django.utils.functional.classproperty(method=None)[source]

Decorator that converts a method with a single cls argument into a property that can be accessed directly from the class.

fget = None[source]
getter(method)[source]
class django.utils.functional.Promise[source]

Base class for the proxy class created in the closure of the lazy function. It’s used to recognize promises in code.

django.utils.functional.lazy(func, *resultclasses)[source]

Turn any callable into a lazy evaluated callable. result classes or types is required – at least one is needed so that the automatic forcing of the lazy evaluation code is triggered. Results are not memoized; the function is evaluated on every access.

django.utils.functional.lazystr(text)[source]

Shortcut for the common case of a lazy callable that returns str.

django.utils.functional.keep_lazy(*resultclasses)[source]

A decorator that allows a function to be called with one or more lazy arguments. If none of the args are lazy, the function is evaluated immediately, otherwise a __proxy__ is returned that will evaluate the function when needed.

django.utils.functional.keep_lazy_text(func)[source]

A decorator for functions that accept lazy arguments and return text.

django.utils.functional.empty[source]
django.utils.functional.new_method_proxy(func)[source]
class django.utils.functional.LazyObject[source]

A wrapper for another class that can be used to delay instantiation of the wrapped class.

By subclassing, you have the opportunity to intercept and alter the instantiation. If you don’t need to do that, use SimpleLazyObject.

django.utils.functional.unpickle_lazyobject(wrapped)[source]

Used to unpickle lazy objects. Just return its argument, which will be the wrapped object.

class django.utils.functional.SimpleLazyObject(func)[source]

Bases: LazyObject

A lazy object initialized from any function.

Designed for compound objects of unknown type. For builtins or objects of known type, use django.utils.functional.lazy.

django.utils.functional.partition(predicate, values)[source]

Split the values into two sets, based on the return value of the function (True/False). e.g.:

>>> partition(lambda x: x > 3, range(5))
[0, 1, 2, 3], [4]
